prompt: A set of sentences is CONSISTENT if:
options: The sentences don't contradict each other
explanation: A set Γ is consistent if there's no sentence φ such that Γ ⊢ φ and Γ ⊢ ¬φ. Equivalently, there exists a model satisfying all of Γ. Inconsistent sets prove everything (explosion principle).
visual_concept: Consistent: The sentences can all be true together in at least one possible world. Inconsistent: No possible world makes them all true.
